name.japanese: フロリアントライアングル

description: A mysterious fog-shrouded region in Paradise where over 100 ships disappear every year. The fog is so thick that it's impossible to distinguish day from night. Ships have vanished in this area for centuries, long before Gecko Moria arrived.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Enter the Florian Triangle
keyEvents.description: After opening a mysterious barrel that triggers a flare, the Straw Hats are caught in a storm and pulled into the Florian Triangle.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the beginning of the Thriller Bark arc and introduces one of the most dangerous regions in Paradise.

keyEvents.title: First Appearance of the Florian Triangle
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hats find themselves in the fog-shrouded Florian Triangle, which Luffy recognizes as the 'ghost sea' that Kokoro warned them about.
keyEvents.significance: Introduction of the setting for the entire Thriller Bark arc, a graveyard of ships with supernatural elements.

geography.climate: Perpetually foggy, impossible to distinguish day from night
geography.terrain: Open sea covered in thick fog
notableFeatures: Extremely thick fog covering the entire sea
Ghost ships drifting through the mist
Massive creatures lurking in the fog

historicalSignificance: Ships have been disappearing in the Florian Triangle for centuries, creating legends of ghost ships. Gecko Moria settled here 12 years before the main story to use the fog to capture passing vessels and steal their shadows.
culturalSignificance: Known throughout the world as a cursed sea where ships vanish without a trace, similar to the real-world Bermuda Triangle.

description: A massive black ship with torn sails drifting through the Florian Triangle. This ghost ship belongs to Brook, the sole survivor of the Rumbar Pirates, and has been his home for decades of isolation.

keyEvents.title: Ghost Ship Appears Through the Fog
keyEvents.description: A haunting song echoes through the fog as a massive black ship with torn sails emerges from the mist, with Brook singing aboard it.
keyEvents.significance: The eerie appearance of Brook's ship sets the supernatural tone for the Thriller Bark arc.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Board the Ghost Ship
keyEvents.description: Luffy, Nami, and Sanji board Brook's ship to investigate and meet the skeleton.
keyEvents.significance: The crew's willingness to explore this mysterious vessel leads to their first meeting with Brook.

keyEvents.title: Brook Greets Visitors Aboard His Ship
keyEvents.description: Brook formally greets the Straw Hats aboard his ship, expressing joy at finally meeting real people after years of isolation.
keyEvents.significance: This ship has been Brook's prison and home for decades, representing his isolation from humanity.

notableFeatures: Home to Brook, the living skeleton

historicalSignificance: This ship belonged to the Rumbar Pirates and is where Brook has existed alone as a skeleton for approximately 50 years after his crew's death.
culturalSignificance: Represents Brook's isolation and the tragedy of the Rumbar Pirates. The ship drifting endlessly in the fog symbolizes Brook's existence in limbo.

name.japanese: サウザンド・サニー号

description: The Straw Hat Pirates' second ship, built by Franky and the Galley-La Company. A brigantine-rigged sloop with a lion figurehead and advanced features including the Soldier Dock System.

keyEvents.title: Peaceful Day Aboard the Sunny
keyEvents.description: The crew enjoys a peaceful day on the Thousand Sunny with various activities including swinging, gardening, and ship maintenance.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the crew's life aboard their new ship before the supernatural events begin.

keyEvents.title: Thousand Sunny Enters the Florian Triangle
keyEvents.description: After a sudden storm, Franky uses the Paddle Ship system to navigate, but they end up in the Florian Triangle.
keyEvents.significance: The Sunny carries the crew into one of the most dangerous regions in the Grand Line.

notableFeatures: Soldier Dock System with various channels

historicalSignificance: The Straw Hats' ship after the Going Merry, built specifically for them to continue their journey through the Grand Line.
culturalSignificance: Represents the crew's growth and their bond with Franky who built it.
